errors.error_description: The command `pip install --upgrade` is incomplete and will fail. It needs to specify the `pip` package itself for the upgrade to work.
correction_candidates: Then, upgrade to the latest pip with the following command: `python -m pip install --upgrade pip`
Then, upgrade to the latest pip with the following command: `pip install pip --upgrade`
Then, upgrade to the latest pip with the following command: `pip upgrade`
Then, upgrade to the latest pip with the following command: `pip install --upgrade`
errors.golden_answer: Then, upgrade to the latest pip with the following command: `python -m pip install --upgrade pip`

errors.error_description: The documentation incorrectly states that pip supports Python 2.7+. Modern versions of pip require Python 3.7 or newer.
correction_candidates: To get started with pip, make sure you have Python 3.7+ installed.
To get started with pip, make sure you have the latest Python 3 installed.
To get started with pip, make sure you have Python 3.6+ installed.
To get started with pip, make sure you have Python 2.7 or Python 3.5+ installed.
errors.golden_answer: To get started with pip, make sure you have Python 3.7+ installed.
